data.question: What are the names of the three mesh-adjustable molecular sieves discussed?
What is the relationship between mesh size and temperature for the molecular sieves?
What is the significance of the tert-butyl group in the molecular sieves?
data.answer: The tert-butyl group acts as a gate for gas molecules, controlling access to the hydrophobic cages.

data.question: True or False: The choice of metal affects the mesh adjustment in the molecular sieves.
At what temperature does MAMS-2 start to adsorb a significant amount of O2?
What is the role of the hydrophilic channels in the molecular sieves?
data.answer: They act as passages allowing gas molecules to enter the hydrophobic cages.

data.question: True or False: The hydrophobic cages serve as the main space for gas storage in the molecular sieves.
What happens to the gates of the molecular sieves when the temperature is increased?
data.answer: The gates open wider due to reduced van der Waals interaction among the tert-butyl groups.

data.question: True or False: MAMS-2 can distinguish methane from ethylene at 143 K.
What is the linear equation relating gate opening and temperature for the molecular sieves?
True or False: The unit cell parameters of the molecular sieves remain constant with temperature changes from 113 to 273 K.
What is the estimated gate opening at 77 K based on experimental data?
True or False: Activation of the hydrophilic channels is necessary for gas adsorption on MAMSs.
What is the upper limit of the channel size that precludes the entrance of isobutane?
True or False: Changing the tert-butyl group to other functional groups like methyl or isopropyl can lead to different values for D0 and α.
What is the main function of the hydrophobic cages in the molecular sieves?
data.answer: To serve as the main space for gas storage

data.question: True or False: The molecular sieves can separate any two gases with kinetic diameters in the range of 2.9-4.6 Å.
What is the correlation coefficient of the linear equation relating gate opening and temperature?
True or False: The molecular sieving effect is attributed to the size of the hydrophilic channels.
What is the significance of the van der Waals interaction among tert-butyl groups in the molecular sieves?
data.answer: It controls the opening of gates, allowing or restricting access to the hydrophobic cages.
